intro: Blumea sylvatica var. pachycephala, commonly known as the thick-headed blumea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
